title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: GeoLocatoR designed help create work GeoLocator Data Package (GeoLocator DP), standardized format geolocator data follows Data Package standard, ensuring data organized, accessible, ready share.

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: Creates GeoLocator Data Package: Create geolocator datapackage object, add resources (data), write data package preferred directory. , read existing data package directory Zenodo. Works Seamlessly GeoPressureTemplate: GeoLocatoR compatible GeoPressureTemplate ‚Äî template repository analyzing geolocator data using GeoPressureR. Use together streamline analysis maintain standardized project structure. Supports Swiss Ornithological Institute Data: Special functions designed deal internal SOI data. See vignette. Built frictionless-r: package built using frictionless-r package, adhering Frictionless Data standards open data.

title: R package for GeoLocator Data Package
text: Data Package lightweight format packaging data using Data Package standard. provides framework organizing data files, metadata, descriptive information consistent reusable manner. geolocator data, ensures information tagged birds, movements, associated metadata bundled single exchangeable package. Learn GeoLocator DP standard .

what: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
text: function create geolocator data package R object. arguments functions correspond standard geolocator Data Package properties. function initiate Geolocator Data Package R object. function similar frictionless::create_package() required specific metadata provided arguments function rather list descriptor. arguments correspond field datapackage.json. geolocator data package also Data Package object created frictionless::create_package()  (?) functions frictionless package work. Note function add data resources, returns empty shell project level metadata.

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
code: create_gldp(   title = "",   contributors = list(list(title = "")),   embargo = "1970-01-01",   licenses = list(list(name = "CC-BY-4.0", title = "Creative Commons Attribution 4.0",     path = "https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/")),   id = NULL,   description = NULL,   version = NULL,   relatedIdentifiers = NULL,   grants = NULL,   keywords = NULL,   created = format(as.POSIXct(Sys.time(), tz = "UTC"), "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%SZ"),   bibliographicCitation = NULL,   schema = NULL )

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
text: title string providing title one sentence description package. plain text (markup), capitalised like title, end period less 65 characters. See Geolocator DP thw Data Package specification. contributors list contributors, contributor list properties including leas title also optionally givenName, familyName, path, email, roles, organization. See Geolocator DP, Data Package specification R Packages. embargo End date embargo. Default "1970-01-01". See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. licenses list licenses data provided.  Usually, single license sufficient prefered. sure, checkout Creative Commons License Chooser  Open Data Commons . name path must provided. Defaults CC--4.0 license. See Geolocator DP  Data Package specification. id globally unique identifier package, typically DOI link corresponding Zenodo repository can reserved prior publication . Default NULL. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. description markdown-formatted string describing package. can (!) use multiple sentences, limited single paragraph. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. version (optional) version string identifying version package, following Semantic Versioning. Defaults "1.0.0". See Geolocator DP Data Package specification Data Package Version recipe. relatedIdentifiers (optional) list related identifiers package. related identifier list properties relationType relatedIdentifier. See Geolocator DP Camtrap DP specification . grants (optional) list grants funded creation package. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. keywords (optional) list keywords assist users searching package. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. created Datetime created. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. bibliographicCitation (optional) string providing citation package. See Geolocator DP Data Package specification. schema (optional) URL JSON Table Schema describes data package. Defaults GeoLocator Data Package profile. See Data Package specification .

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
text: Geolocator Data Package object containing metadata.

title: Create a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî create_gldp
code: # Create a Data Package with all possible metadata pkg <- create_gldp(   title = "Geolocator Data Package example",   contributors = list(     list(       title = "Rapha√´l Nussbaumer",       roles = c("ContactPerson", "DataCurator", "ProjectLeader")     ),     list(       title = "Yann Rime",       givenName = "Yann",       familyName = "Rime",       path= "https://orcid.org/0000-0003-2745-0557",       email = "yann.rime@vogelwarte.ch",       roles = c("Researcher"),       organization = "Swiss Ornithological Institute"     )   ),   embargo = "2025-01-01",   licenses = list(list(name = "CC-BY-4.0")),   id = "https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13829929",   description = NULL,   version = "1.0.1",   relatedIdentifiers = list(     list(       relationType = "IsPartOf",       relatedIdentifier = "10.5281/zenodo.11207081",       relatedIdentifierType = "DOI"     ),     list(       relationType = "IsSupplementTo",       relatedIdentifier = "10.1007/s00114-018-1566-9",       relatedIdentifierType = "DOI"     )   ),   grants = c("Swiss National Fundation grant no. 354251"),   keywords = c("Woodland Kingfisher", "intra-african", "multi-sensor geolocator"),   created = "2024-05-17",   bibliographicCitation = "Nussbaumer, R., & Rime, Y. (2024). Woodland Kingfisher: Migration   route and timing of South African Woodland Kingfisher (v1.1). Zenodo.   https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.11207141" )

title: Merge Two GeoLocator Data Packages ‚Äî merge_gldp
text: Merges two GeoLocator Data Package objects (x y) single combined package. metadata properties packages merged according specific rules, resource data combined based presence either package.

Merge Two GeoLocator Data Packages ‚Äî merge_gldp

text: single GeoLocator Data Package object containing merged data x y.

title: Merge Two GeoLocator Data Packages ‚Äî merge_gldp
text: Metadata merging rules: title: Combined packages, separated "/". contributors: Combined packages, duplicates removed. embargo: Set latest date packages. licenses: Combined packages, duplicates removed. id: Removed merged package. description: Combined two separate paragraphs, newline separator. version: Removed merged package. relatedIdentifiers: Combined, duplicates removed. grants: Combined packages, duplicates removed. keywords: Combined packages, duplicates removed. created: Set current timestamp time merging. bibliographicCitation: Removed merged package. Custom properties x retained merged package. Resource merging logic: resource checked presence x y. Data sources combined resource exists either x y. Resources included exist least one packages.

what: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: set functions facilitates reading combining Geolocator Data (GDL) associated order information various sources. main function, read_gdl(), allows reading data Access file directly separate CSV files containing GDL data order information. returns data frame integrates GDL data summarized order details.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
code: read_gdl(access_file = NA, data_file = NA, order_file = NA, filter_col = TRUE)  read_gdl_orders(order_file)  read_gdl_data(data_file)  read_gdl_access(   access_file,   data_file = tempfile("GDL_Data", fileext = ".csv"),   order_file = tempfile("GDL_Orders", fileext = ".csv") )

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: access_file string specifying path Access file containing GDL data order information. provided, takes precedence data_file order_file. Defaults NA.  ¬ß data_file string specifying path GDL data file. Required access_file provided. Defaults NA. order_file string specifying path GDL order file. Required access_file provided. Defaults NA. filter_col logical value character vector. TRUE, predefined set columns selected. FALSE, columns included. Alternatively, character vector can passed specify columns select. Defaults TRUE.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: data frame combining GDL data summarized order information. data frame includes columns OrderName, Client, NumberDelivered, GDL_ID, Species, , depending value filter_col.

title: Read Geolocator Data and Orders ‚Äî read_gdl
text: read_gdl() function primary interface reading combining GDL data orders. can read Access file separate data order files. Access file provided, read_gdl_access() function used extract GDL data order information. Otherwise, read_gdl_data() read_gdl_orders() functions employed read data specified CSV files. read_gdl(): Reads GDL order data, either Access file separate CSV files, returns combined data frame. read_gdl_orders(): Reads GDL order information CSV file, including columns like OrderID, OrderName, Species, Client, NumberDelivered. read_gdl_data(): Reads GDL data CSV file, including columns like DataID, OrderName, GDL_ID, Species, spatial temporal information. read_gdl_access(): Extracts GDL data order information Access database file exports temporary CSV files.

code: # Read a datapackage.json file pkg <- read_gldp("https://zenodo.org/records/14099115/files/datapackage.json")  pkg #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ A GeoLocator Data Package (main)  #> ‚Ä¢ title: "GeoLocator Data Package: South African Woodland Kingfisher" #> ‚Ä¢ contributors: #>   Rapha√´l Nussbaumer (rafnuss@gmail.com) (Researcher, ProjectLeader) - #>   <https://orcid.org/0000-0002-8185-1020> #>   Yann Rime (yann.rime@vogelwarte.ch) (Researcher, Contributor) - #>   <https://orcid.org/0009-0005-7264-6753> #> ‚Ä¢ embargo: 1970-01-01 #> ‚Ä¢ licenses: #>   CC BY 4.0 #> ‚Ä¢ id: <https://doi.org/10.5281/zenodo.13829929> #> ‚Ä¢ version: "1.1" #> ‚Ä¢ relatedIdentifiers: #>   IsPartOf <10.5281/zenodo.11207081> #>   IsSupplementTo <> #> ‚Ä¢ grants: "Swiss Ornithological Intitute" #> ‚Ä¢ keywords: "Woodland Kingfisher", "intra-african", and "multi-sensor #>   geolocator" #> ‚Ä¢ created: 2024-11-12 12:58:55 #> ‚Ä¢ spatial: #> ‚Ä¢ temporal: "2017-01-10" to "2019-09-28" #> ‚Ä¢ taxonomic: "Halcyon senegalensis" #> ‚Ä¢ numberTags: #>  #> ‚îÄ‚îÄ 8 resources:  #> ‚Ä¢ tags #> ‚Ä¢ observations #> ‚Ä¢ measurements #> ‚Ä¢ twilights #> ‚Ä¢ staps #> ‚Ä¢ paths #> ‚Ä¢ edges #> ‚Ä¢ pressurepaths #> Use `unclass()` to print the Geolocator Data Package as a list.

title: Transform Tags to a Tidy Data Frame ‚Äî tags2m
text: tibble (data frame) columns: tag_id character vector representing unique identifier tag. sensor character vector representing type sensor measurement, including types like "activity", "pitch", "light", "temperature_external", etc. datetime POSIXct datetime object representing timestamp measurements. value numeric vector containing sensor measurement values. label character vector additional labeling, NA present original data.

title: Transform Tags to a Tidy Data Frame ‚Äî tags2m
text: tags2m() function extracts processes sensor data list tags. renames value column corresponding sensor type exists, ensures presence label column, reshapes data long format. function handles various sensor types pressure, acceleration, light, temperature, magnetic fields. tags provided, function returns empty tibble appropriate column names types.

what: Update computed metadata of a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî update_gldp
title: Update computed metadata of a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî update_gldp
text: function update/create following metadata existing GeoLocator Data Package based data contained within package. update_gldp_temporal(): Sets pkg$temporal date range datetime values measurements resource, available. update_gldp_spatial(): Sets pkg$spatial GeoJSON bounding box locations found observation, paths pressurepaths. update_gldp_taxonomic(): Sets pkg$taxonomic unique tags$scientific_name found observations. update_gldp_number_tags(): update_gldp_bibliographic_citation(): Sets pkg$bibliographicCitation formatted utils::bibentry() current package. update_gldp_reference_location(): Sets pkg$reference_location field median latitude longitude values observations resource, available. update_gldp_metadata: Re-arrange order properties according order schema update_gldp performs functions mentioned .

title: Update computed metadata of a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî update_gldp
code: update_gldp(pkg)  update_gldp_temporal(pkg)  update_gldp_spatial(pkg)  update_gldp_taxonomic(pkg)  update_gldp_number_tags(pkg)  update_gldp_bibliographic_citation(pkg, ...)  update_gldp_reference_location(pkg)  update_gldp_metadata(pkg)

what: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp
title: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp
text: function performs comprehensive validation GeoLocator Data Package checking package metadata, profile, resources. validation includes verifying package conforms GeoLocator Data Package profile resource adheres schema.

title: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp

what: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp_py
title: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp_py
text: function validates GeoLocator Data Package using frictionless command-line tool. writes package metadata JSON file performs validation ensure package conforms required standards. function supports two modes: validating package metadata validating entire package including resources.

title: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp_py
code: validate_gldp_py(   pkg,   path = "/Users/rafnuss/anaconda3/bin/",   only_package = NULL,   pkg_dir = tempdir() )

title: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp_py
text: pkg object class "geolocatordp" representing GeoLocator Data Package validated. path string specifying path directory containing frictionless executable. Defaults "/Users/rafnuss/anaconda3/bin/". only_package logical indicating whether validate package metadata (TRUE) entire package including resources (FALSE). Defaults NULL, case determined based presence resources package. pkg_dir string specifying directory package files written validation. Defaults temporary directory created tempdir().

title: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp_py
text: NULL. function performs validation side effect return value.

title: Validate a GeoLocator Data Package ‚Äî validate_gldp_py
text: function performs following steps: only_package TRUE package contains resources, writes metadata JSON file validates . only_package FALSE resources present, writes entire package, including resources, directory validates . Executes frictionless validation command using specified path frictionless executable.

text: GeoLocator DP version number (e.g. 1.0).

title: Get GeoLocator DP version ‚Äî version
text: version number derived follows: version attribute, defined. version number contained x$profile, expected contain URL used GeoLocator DP standard. x$profile entirety (can NULL).
